data.title: add dynamic linker support
data.body:
# Why do we need it?

with the work of @reduz and alket soon we can have an asset sharing  ( addon ) but the missing system is that this addons is all in gd script but there are so many works that can be done in modules like add Admob,IAP,OpenCV,CameraCaputre,VRsupport and so many more , this modules should be compiled and it's scary for beginners just to clone the godot repo add the module then download dependencies and compile it but think about it if the modules is compiled and can be added to engine it will be great.
# Problems
- first of all that this modules should be compiled with compilers that the godot was compiled
- every version of godot can load just the modules for that version
- our last problem how can we implement it that it will be simple and easy to use both for module developers and engine users

my solution is that we just support those release on steam and in site the stable versions and if someone wants a custom version he should download the modules code and compile it themselves, for compatibility issue the modules should have a supported version and for different platform the compiled version should exist.

@akien-mga I will appreciate it if you  add feature request and discussion label to this issue

data.title: Can't zoom with a tablet
data.body:
The 2D or 3D editor workspaces can be zoomed with a mousewheel, but it can't be done easily with a graphics tablet.

Panning the view can be done with Space + drag.

Could there be a modifier key to zoom the view also?

data.title: Added epoc to dictionary converter (for human readable display when only given an epoc time)
data.body:
Useful for when user is storing time as epoc and wants to do operations on this
time and then display in human readable form

https://www.facebook.com/groups/godotengine/permalink/737469773056286/?comment_id=738011009668829&reply_comment_id=738192799650650&notif_t=group_comment_reply

data.title: abs() for Vector types (3D and 2D)
data.body:
Currently abs() is not available for Vector types. But seeing how vector maths is super common in game development and abs() is just about one of the most common operations you do on vectors it's needed.
I'll use 3D vectors as an example but it concerns 2D vectors as well.

Doing it manually is tedious, long to write, poorly readable and error prone.
A single typo in this 'sqrt(pow(TESTVEC3D.x,2) + pow(TESTVEC3D.y,2) + pow(TESTVEC3D.z,2))' and awkward things happen that are hard to debug because it's still a legal operation, just not what you wanted. 

The alternative 'TESTVEC3D.distance_to(Vector3(0,0,0))' is slightly better but still heaps worse than a simple 'abs(TESTVEC3D)'.

data.title: Fix Sprite doesn't updating region_rect value in certain conditions
data.body: Closes #3876.

data.title: Removed "__editor_plugin_screen__" metadata creation
data.body:
Now the editor will not create the `__editor_plugin_screen__` metadata in scenes. I removed it because it's useless, if the editor select one tab, using the metadata, after this  it'll use the root node to find the proper editor(2D/3D).

Fixes #3801.

data.title: Latest release does not have correct export templates
data.body:
I just downloaded Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_win32.exe

And then I used this to export my game to windows (.exe) and got an error saying:

`godot pack created with newer version of engine`

So I redownloaded the new export template from the main website and installed it. 

Now it all works wonderfully!

But I think the latest export templates should be included in the latest Godot release? Just a suggestion, thx. Engine works great now though, very fast, love it

data.title: remove trailing whitespace
data.body: You shouldn't trust such big commits. And to check that it only changes whitespace characters at the end of lines, you can append `?w=` at the end of commit URL ( https://github.com/Marqin/godot/commit/583a802185fe953d495d3d85adf9fb7a1556707b?w=1 ) and Github will hide all non-whitespace changes. Also, there are some [flags](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-show) for `git show` to hide whitespace changes.

data.title: Added search box in Class List dialog (Script Editor)
data.body:
Included a search box in the Class List dialog of the Script Editor. The search works like in the Create dialog.

Fixes #3645.

data.title: Button/Texturebutton pushed and focused textures conflict
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
All

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When pushing button the pushed texture should be visible.
Instead focused texture is drawn over - so pushed texture is not visible.

Problem is not showing where no focused texture is added. But to properly support gamepads/keyboard it is important to have focus indicator.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- clone this project https://github.com/w84death/buttonbug
- hover mouse over button
- press

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/w84death/buttonbug

data.title: UI glitch on editor view pane
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
OS: Ubuntu 15.10 64-bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I compiled the engine from source at the master branch with commit HEAD 5a9b18b using `$ scons platform=x11`. I cloned and opened an open-source project [Tanks of Freedom](https://github.com/w84death/Tanks-of-Freedom). Then, opened the game scene (`game.xscn`) under the 2D view. When I tried to super zoom in on the editor and scrolled left and right, this what happened:

![godot engine issue 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3685613/13546156/b99f88f6-e2df-11e5-9d54-aaa3a66dcb63.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
Prerequisite
- Compiled the engine from source
- Downloaded the `Tanks of Freedom` project
```
1. Open `Tanks of Freedom` project
2. Open the file `game.xscn` under 2D view
3. Zoom in 10x on the editor
4. Scroll left and right

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/w84death/Tanks-of-Freedom

data.title: From GitHub HEAD (Addons): print() function prints on different places depending on the script.
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Linux Mint, Godot from GitHub HEAD (as in 3/4/2016).

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I modified the CustomDock Addon so I could see how to print stuff on the Godot Engine output; but unlike the dock_plugin.gd (which prints correctly on the Editor output), the custom_dock.gd prints on the Linux terminal (which I had to use to open Godot, so I could check on the output).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Using Godot from GitHub HEAD:
- Use a print function on both custom_dock.gd and dock_plugin.gd from the Custom_dock example;
- Run Godot using terminal ("./godot.x11.tools.64");
- Check the print on different places.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Both modified scripts that I used: https://gist.github.com/henriquelalves/97ebdf271f25cd3d5d25
I created a signal between the button of the CustomDock to a function which just print an arbitrary string.

data.title: GDScript Documentation
data.body: I wrote the descriptions for the built-in gdscript functions. The only one remaining is the `str2var`. I couldn't figure out from Godot nor the source code, what it does. Any ideas?

data.title: Magnetometer/compass support
data.body:
People are doing really cool things with magnetometers. Godot supports accelerometers on Android (not sure about other platforms), and combined with magnetometer data it would be possible to determine a device's orientation on a planet, provided the device is not in freefall. This can be observed in the Google Sky app and various 3D compass apps.

Specific to the Android platform, there are potential issues with calibration (as in TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD vs TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD_UNCALIBRATED) so it's up to the implementer which flag would be used and how it would work. I'm sure that as time goes on Godot will acquire more uniform sensor support across platforms. Every device that comforms to each platform specification provides sensor data in the same format for that platform, so any issues with calibration and accuracy could be expected to be the same no matter what device is used.

data.title: Code Comments
data.body:
I think it would be a good idea to add comments to the code, mainly for the header files, comments for function definitions. This would be a great addition for example for guys that use an IDE such as Visual Studio, because when you hover over a function call, it shows these comments.

Also see #3916.

Again, I would love to make this happen, just need to see if this is desired. Existing documentation could be put into the code. Personally I think that this would be better than having a separate file for function descriptions.

data.title: Coding standards
data.body:
So after making my first contribution, I think that Godot's codebase really needs some coding standards and a way to enforce them. At least some basics like name conventions, tab indentation, etc.

It would be cool if existing code could be automatically processed (beautified). I could try to do this, just need your opinion on this guys.

data.title: Ability to inspect object members values during debugging
data.body:
While debugging / stepping through code, it's desirable to view the values of variables in current scope. 

Unfortunately, the palette on the bottom with current scope displays only simple types ( numbers, strings, etc ), and not objects / nodes. Instead, objects show up as "0" when hovering over variable names in text. It would be great if one could inspect the object that variable points to, or at the very least, show something like "[KinematicBody2D: 564]", so one could at least know its type. Ideally, it would be nice to be able to inspect objects in their entirety, with fields and all.

It would also be great, if there was a console while debugging, allowing execution of statements in current scope. So I could enter "print( varName )", like in Chrome javascript console, for example.

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer (OneShot): reset oneshot anim on start.
data.body: Seek the oneshot animation (but not the main animation) back to zero when you fire the oneshot so that it works reliably and more than once.

data.title: Script editor scroll too fast with trackpad in OSX.
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
OSX, trackpad

**Issue description:**
GDScript editor scroll too fast vertical and too slow horizontal with trackpad. It hard to scroll & view with long script file or help file.

data.title: Where is Vector3.angle_to ?
data.body:
Vector2.angle_to( Vector2 ) is a possible function, a useful onetoo.
So where is Vector3.angle_to( Vector3 ) ?
It isn't very complicated to implement, I don't know how the Vector2 one is made but the one I custom-make constantly works like this:

`cos(a.dot(b) / (a.length() * b.length()))`

EDIT: A more efficent way to do this;
`acos( a.dot(b) / sqrt(a.length_squared() * b.length_squared()) )`
(Thanks @bojidar-bg )

Also cos should be acos instead, sorry typo

data.title: Add a signal for RigidBodies to determine when sleeping state has changed
data.body:
It would be great if RigidBodies ( 2D and 3D ) emitted a signal that would notify when it has gone to sleep, or has been awakened.

Parts of my scene get unloaded / freed when all bodies within have settled down / gone to sleep. I can't easily determine this without having to run a timer.

data.title: Completion tooltip
data.body:
I moved the hint under the current line, so it looks like this:

![it1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13506668/7efa3e3c-e17f-11e5-872f-b71fa52ca3d3.png)

It gets disabled when the code completion appears.

![hint1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13507330/6ba95a90-e182-11e5-9adc-7a5fe6660c41.png)
![hint2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13507328/6ba31aa4-e182-11e5-9876-24fa6bd8acfe.png)
![hint3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13507329/6ba40aae-e182-11e5-904c-e6931b9d7d6b.png)

Closes #1261.
#### UPDATE:

I have added editor settings:

![hint4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13524137/c4f6b6ac-e1f9-11e5-8769-808ff8026487.png)

And it all works as expected:

![hint5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13524150/d587056c-e1f9-11e5-9b6d-5e79898311aa.png)
![hint6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4700122/13524151/d587ccd6-e1f9-11e5-8574-0fb03d23dff6.png)

The call hint tooltip gets hidden only when it has to (when to completion is shown on the same side).
